definition: Gustave Flaubert (1821-1880), French realist novelist, author of Madame Bovary
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]

sentences.english: Persky tossed in a paperback copy of Flaubert's novel.
sentences.chinese: 帕斯基把福樓拜那本小說的平裝本扔了進去。

sentences.english: Madame Bovery was written by Flaubert.
